Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou? Do you have a minute?
Of course, Nenohi. Please, take a seat. What's on your mind?
Well... we've been traveling together for some time now...
Correct.
And we've been through so much already...
That we have.
So, I was wondering... if you'd permit me to use informal speech during our conversations from now on!

Fields.MenuText: My rank isn't in question, is it?
May I do the same?

Fields.DialogueText: Never, Kanchou! I just find it odd that I address you the same way I would a stranger!
You already refer to me by my first name so brazenly... To be honest, it's a little embarrassing... "Hatsuharu" is my class name, you know...

Fields.MenuText: Is it easier for you to converse that way?

Fields.DialogueText: Not really. I can switch between formal and informal language without a second thought. It's the implication...
Very well. I see no reason why not to allow it.
Yatta! Wah, meccha shinpaishita~.
You were that worried?
Kanchou is still a distinguished sailor, after all. Regardless, it makes me happy I no longer have to censor myself...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Depending on the amount of curse words we throw their way, I may ask you to censor yourself yet!
Makasete! Kanchou wo zettai mamorundayo!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Kite, kite!
Everything all right, Nenohi? Rifling through your stamp collection again, are you?
Boo, boo! Chigau! Guess again!
What are these...? Postcards?
My stamp collection was becoming unruly. So I decided to explore a new avenue. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: First stamps and now postcards? What's next, model trains?

Fields.DialogueText: Nande sono kao... What do you have against my hobbies, Kanchou!? We can't all be lion tamers in our spare time, you know?

Fields.MenuText: Why postcards?

Fields.DialogueText: They're essentially just larger stamps! Look, I can still collect them from all over the world, but these have much larger pictures!

Fields.MenuText: How many do you have so far?

Fields.DialogueText: I've been gifted a few from the crew, but I am looking to expand. You don't have any relatives from Africa, do you? It would really help pull the collection together!
Well, so long as it doesn't interfere with your duties, I see no reason to discourage you.
I wanted to ask, Kanchou. We'll dock soon, right? Perhaps we could scout the local vendors to add to my collection.
*ALARM*
I'll tell you what. You take out these Morganas in record time and I'll personally buy you a postcard of your choice.
Ryōkai! Arigatō, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
We'll dock soon, Nenohi. Have you made the necessary preparations?
*BZZZZ*
Come in! Kikoemasuka? Moshi moshi?
*BZZZZ*
Dame ka na?
What seems to be the problem?
The radio is on the fritz. I can't make contact with anyone.

Fields.MenuText: How have your language studies been going recently?

Fields.DialogueText: With the radio in its current state, I haven't felt very motivated to continue my studies. Gomenne, Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: I had hoped using the radio would have reined you in a little.

Fields.DialogueText: Dōbutsu jyanaiyo, Kanchou! Although, I understand I can be a little... "wild" at times... I am a destroyer, after all.

Fields.MenuText: Do you know what's wrong with it?

Fields.DialogueText: Old age comes for us all eventually, Kanchou.
Maybe we should throw it out and replace it with a newer model.
Souka... So, that's the kind of person you are. One who trades out the aged for a younger model! Hmph!
Uh... Are we still talking about the radio, here?
*BZZZZrttt*
It can't be helped. We'll have to pick one up at the next port along with your postcards.
We sure are buying a lot, Kanchou. We'll probably be spending the whole day together walking around.
You're right. We may have to stop for a meal halfway through.
It almost sounds like a da--
Nenohi...? Sounds like a what?
*ALARM*
It sounds like a daring adventure! I was talking about fighting these Morganas, of course! Kanchou, quickly!
Didn't the alarm ring after you stopped talking...?
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Do you have a minute?
Of course, Nenohi. Please take a seat. What's on your...
Dou...? Niau?
*Gulp* Wow...
Yappari, oshare sugi da ne! Ima sugu kigaeru!
Now, wait a minute! I didn't say it was bad. What's with the wardrobe change?
I was trying to pick out an outfit for our... walk. This outfit matches what I imagine the interior of a radio market to look like.
Although, perhaps it would be better to match the colorful postcard stand instead.

Fields.MenuText: Either way, you're overdressed...

Fields.DialogueText: It's rare we get to spend so much time on land together, so I wanted to look my best...

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what radio store has a dress code. Especially one that requires ball gowns.

Fields.DialogueText: Technology has come a long way in recent years, Kanchou! These places are getting ritzier by the day!

Fields.MenuText: Have you always looked so...?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Kanchou? It seems like you were about to say something very, VERY important.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Best you change back into your regular outfit, Nenohi. We wouldn't want to get oil and seawater on your nice dress.
Shouganai ne? It's too difficult to move in this anyway! I need freedom of movement when taking down Morganas!
@BATTLE
Kimochii ne~. Fresh land air and fresh sea air are incomparable!
Call me old-fashioned, but I like the smell of the sea.
Kanchou, you really are a workaholic, aren't you?
Okay, okay, that's enough teasing. Look, over there, perhaps this gentleman can point us in the right direction.
Excuse me, sir?
May I help you?
We're looking for a place to buy postcards and radios.
You're just out of luck! They closed the ol' postcard and radio store no less than three nights ago, hehehe!
*ALARM*
Did you hear that, Kanchou! Morganas must be approaching!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe if we save this guy's life, he'll cut it out with all the jokes!

Fields.DialogueText: I second that! Although I did think it was kind of funny...

Fields.MenuText: If we protect you, do you think you could help us?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll certainly do my best, hehehe!

Fields.MenuText: Look, old man. We're in a hurry, so if you could just--

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! That's no way to address anyone, regardless of their age. I see you weren't lying when you mentioned your penchant for younger models!
I'm not in the mood for dying today. I still have all these weapons to sell. Say you scratch my back and I scratch yours.
That's all we needed to hear! Nenohi, with me!
@BATTLE
Phew! You really saved my bacon back there, hehehe!
Will you be holding up your end of the bargain?
But of course! If you head straight, you should happen upon a shopping district. You'll be able to find all you need inside there.
Arigatō gozaimasu!
We'll be on our way then.
Hold your horses, Buster. I see you have a mighty fine ship at your disposal.
Iwanaide! Hazukashii!
Perhaps you'd like to treat the lovely lady to a new bomber? Seeing as you saved my life, I can offer you a great bargain. Buy one for the price of two and get one free, hehehe!

Fields.MenuText: Nenohi seems charmed by you for some reason, so I guess I don't have a choice.

Fields.DialogueText: Otsukare, Kanchou! You're supporting local business and trouncing your phobia of the octogenerian! Omedetō!

Fields.MenuText: I think you've taken up enough of our time for one day.

Fields.DialogueText: Although we are very grateful for the directions! No need to be rude, Kanchou!
I think I can see some Morganas at the marina up ahead. They'll lead us straight to the shopping district!
Well then, what are we waiting for?! Shūppatsu!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I don't think even one would be worth the refit.

Fields.DialogueText: A man after my own heart. I know a thing or two about avoiding unnecessary work.
Look at this place, Kanchou! It's massive!
Try not to get distracted. Remember, we're here on a mission.
I can't help it! The markets, the merchandise, the Morganas... eh? Chotto mate.
Good eye, Nenohi. One of these things is not like the other! Let's take them down!
@BATTLE
There looks to be a tech shop over here, Kanchou.
So there does. How about this one?
Kanchou! Taka sugi da yo! We can't afford that.

Fields.MenuText: I don't mind paying if it's for you.
We can stretch the budget a little for necessities.
You can pay me back in installments.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm unsure whether I should be disheartened that I'll be making repayments until my dying breath or flattered that you plan to keep me around for that long...
As long as you're sure...
Nani ittendayo... Hazukashii...
Go on then, try it on.
Try it on?
It's portable. This way, you can strap it to your waist and communicate while on the front lines.
I know you've been feeling less motivated to study due to being restricted behind a desk. Hopefully, with this, you can have the best of both worlds! Just make sure to not go too far ahead, okay?
Nenohi?
P?
Postcards... Over there...
Ah! Right you are. Shall we take a look?
Te...
Te?
Te wo tsunaide!
You want to hold hands?
Un...
Sure. Come on, we're running out of daylight.
Okay, here we are. We still have a little time before the sun sets, so take a thorough look and pick out your favorite. My treat!
Hm? Ah! I can't decide! Which postcard do you like the look of, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: The autumn leaves.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Kouyou da! This one is from Hakone, I can already tell! Japanese sakura are always praised but, as you can see, Autumn is just as beautiful!

Fields.MenuText: The large skyscraper.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the Empire State Building, Kanchou! It's not just "some skyscraper"!

Fields.MenuText: The heavy downpour.

Fields.DialogueText: Can you see the clock tower in the back? That's Big Ben, so this must be from London. Hen da ne? People from Britain seem to take pride in their terrible weather.
What about this one?
Kirei~! That waterfall is beautiful! And the surrounding trees are so vibrant...
Where do you think it's from?
I'm not sure. There's no indication of an origin.
Maybe we should keep looking. You wanted a card from Africa, right?
Unless... We scour the globe and track down this mystery location together!
Say what now?
Chotto kangaete, Kanchou! For all we know, this postcard could be Africa. It could be Japan, or it could be the Morgana home world! We'll never know unless we track it down!
We could spend a lifetime searching and never find it!
Then at least we'd die knowing we did everything in our power to fulfil our aspiration.
Very well. I know when I'm beat. You've got that look in your eye that says you won't take no for an answer.
Yatta! Just in time, too! The sun's about to set. Let's head back to the ship. I'm sure there's a Morgana or two waiting to take us by surprise!
@BATTLE
How is the new radio treating you, Nenohi?
It's wonderful, Kanchou! I'm just itching to test it in battle!
*ALARM*
Well, here's your chance. Let's dispatch these Morganas quickly!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Phew! Chotto muzukashikatta!
Is there a problem?
The radio is so large it's a little difficult for me to balance, what with all my other gear ornamenting me as well.

Fields.MenuText: Could we do away with some of your other gear?

Fields.DialogueText: Zettai damedayo! All my gear is essential! First aid kits, my katana, and twin sets of artillery! How could I call myself a destroyer without them!?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could try balancing some books on your head for practice.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Well, I suppose it could work, considering it's all about posture alignment. Maybe if... oh... You're teasing me... Kanchou ijiwaru...

Fields.MenuText: We can always return the radio for a smaller model?

Fields.DialogueText: First, you want to replace an older model with a younger one. Now, you're telling me that you require a smaller size as well!? Your standards are too high, Kanchou...
Maybe we could try some stance exercises. Your katana has seen very little action. When was the last time you trained with it?
That's a good idea, Kanchou! Sword combat is all about balance and perfect stances. If I practice my strikes while wearing the radio, it may help me see where I can improve!
Perfect! Meet me on the deck and we can try it together.
Hai!
Arigatou, Kanchou. For helping me out yet again.
Don't mention it. Although, I'm not very well-versed in traditional sword-to-sword combat.
Daijōbudayo! Teaching you will act as a refresher for me. Here, take hold of my sword.
Like this?
Hm... Tasshikani, that is how most people would hold it. That is perhaps the stance I have been taking on the battlefield instinctively as well. I can see what's wrong. Here...
Ha!? Nenohi!?
I'll just wrap myself around you and fix your posture. Relax your shoulders and square your hips.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been versed in the sword arts?

Fields.DialogueText: It's always good to have a backup strategy. Should I miss my entire arsenal, I'll have a final shot at survival.

Fields.MenuText: What made you adopt a katana?

Fields.DialogueText: The katana is the traditional samurai weapon, but I am not particularly interested in all that. The katana is, in fact, unable to cut through even bamboo without the correct technique.
It takes years of dedication to master the craft and I'm always up for a challenge!

Fields.MenuText: Is this okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Un! Very good, Kanchou! You'll be a sword-swinging warrior yet!
Aren't you a little too close, Nenohi?
Eh!? Why didn't you say something sooner!
I think I did...
*Ahem* Tonikaku, I'll fetch you a sword and we can spar for a while. You would do good to learn some defensive techniques as well, Kanchou. If I'm ever not around.
Won't you always be by my side to defend me?
*KABOOM*
Morga... Huh? I don't see any...
*ALARM*
If that's the alarm... what was that... Nenohi!? Are you okay?! Your face is bright red and it looks as though steam is pouring from your scalp!
I'll be fine, Kanchou... Just please, don't say anymore...
@BATTLE
Gomenne, Kanchou. I could have sworn I had a spare katana lying around somewhere.
That's fine. You're already making amends.
Seeing as we're docked for a while, I thought I would call in a favor from an old crewmate. We often write to each other, and all it took was a quick radio message to ask them to come down!
It looks like this may be them now.
Hisashiburi!
It's been a long time, Nenohi. You look well.
Arigatou! Did you bring what I asked for?
Right here. This is the sword I used in our first duel. I barely touch it nowadays so you can have it.
Kanchou, mite! Sugoi deshō!?
Thank you for this, truly. Is there any way we can repay you?
I wouldn't ask for payment for a gift but, if you wanted to purchase some new weaponry, I have lots lying around that I need to get rid of. You'd be doing me  great service taking it off my hands.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think we can stretch the budget for a new radio AND some new firepower.
For Nenohi's friend, of course!

Fields.DialogueText: Tasshikani, we did spend a lot recently. Maybe next time!
Yatta! A new sword and a new weapon!? It must be my birthday!
I think I see some Morganas blocking our exit.
Perfect! I can test out this new sword and make sure it's up to your incredibly high standards, Kanchou!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: There's "lying around" and there's "in storage." We'll pass.

Fields.DialogueText: Psst! Good call, Kanchou. He does seem like he'd be quite glad to be rid of it.
Enryo shinaide, Kanchou! Come at me with everything you've got!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure it's okay? The radio does look to be weighing you down an awful lot.

Fields.DialogueText: It's important for me to be able to fight and communicate at the same time. If I can't maintain my balance simply holding this thing, what hope is left for me!?
Understood. In that case, I'll be coming at you with everything I've got! KIYA!
You're much better than I thought. Is this the effort of my training?
As a captain, I'm familiar with the basics of most weaponry. I just kept quiet so you could find your bearings.
Uh! I'll make you live to regret that, Kanchou! HA!
*ALARM*
I think you're ready, Nenohi.
Right now?! Haya sugi jya nai?! What if I--?
Te.
Te?
Te wo tsunaide.
Kanchou...
We'll do it together, okay?
Hai!

Fields.MenuText: Wouldn't you prefer a warm-up first?

Fields.DialogueText: This is the warm-up! The Morganas are lying in wait!

Fields.MenuText: You will go easy on me, won't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't make any promises. I am a destroyer, you know. Once I see red, who knows what could happen!
@BATTLE
*BOOF*
Wah~ Tsukareta~ Kanchou? Mada ikiteru?
Don't *pant* kill me off *pant* so easily!
I think I can confidently say I have mastered the art of naval combat and communication!
That *pant* was fast *pant*.
It's all thanks to your efforts, Kanchou. In fact...
No time to be coy, Nenohi. I'm fairly certain that metallic taste in my mouth is blood from a ruptured lung! I may not be long for this world, so spit it out!
Jya... Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Spit it out!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't rush me!

Fields.MenuText: Think carefully. These may be your last words to me if that bright light in the sky is any indication of my time left on this Earth.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the sun, Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Jya... Nenohi...?

Fields.DialogueText: If you tease me, I definitely won't  say!
Ah! Yappari iwanai!
After all that, you won't say anything!?
Perhaps I could write you a letter instead. I've always enjoyed writing and receiving letters. It's what spawned my love of stamp collecting in the first place!
Very well. I'll await a letter from you sometime before I die that will contain information I currently know nothing about...
Onegaishimasu!
*ALARM*
All this talk about letter writing has riled my spirits! Kanchou, do you think you could go another round?
I'll be sure to cheer you on from the sidelines...
@BATTLE
How are you today, Nenohi? Hard at work writing your letter, I see.
Kanchou. Suwate kudasai.
Am I in trouble?
Potentially.
I'll take a seat then.
A thought occurred to me while writing this letter.
Let's hear it.
I have so many pen pals around the globe. So many stamps collected and letters with kind words from friends near and dear to my heart.
Uh huh...
But in all that time, I have yet to receive a single letter from you!

Fields.MenuText: I never felt the need. We're together all the time anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the thought that counts, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not good at writing letters...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not asking you to channel your inner wordsmith. Just something meaningful and earnest.

Fields.MenuText: I believe I wrote you a letter of commendation once!

Fields.DialogueText: Not a letter ABOUT me; a letter TO me!
*ALARM*
Before I hand over my letter to you, I expect you to return the favor.
What am I supposed to write--
Kanchou! Didn't you hear the alarm!? I have Morganas to attend to. Here take some of my supplies to help you get started. Chop, chop!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Jama shiteii?
Of course, Nenohi. Please take a seat.
While working on my letter, I decided to finish up some others I had been neglecting.
I see.
Unfortunately, so much time has elapsed already that should any more pass I worry that my friends will forget about me!
I see. Couldn't we send a quick radio transmission? Do they own a radio?
I had the same thought and did just that! That's why I'm here right now. One of my friends has recently passed their naval officer exam and is looking to find work aboard a ship.
I think I can see where this is going.
Would you be interested in allowing them on board? I can send the confirmation through as soon as you give me an answer.

Fields.MenuText: Any friend of yours is a friend of mine! The more the merrier!

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent! I'll let them know and we can pick them up at the next dock!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think we have room for a new recruit at the moment, unfortunately.

Fields.DialogueText: Understood. Besides, if we so close, we'd have no need to write letters to each other anyway!
AHA! So you admit those in close vicinity to each other don't need to write letters!
You must be hearing things, Kanchou. I said no such thing...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Nenohi, please lend me a hand!
Hai!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We're full up, but I'll see if I can't get them aboard another one of ours.

Fields.DialogueText: Yatta! They'll learn a lot fighting in your group, Kanchou!
Kanchou~ You called for me?
Nenohi... How do you write a letter?
Eh!? Sonnani muzukashii no?
The only letters I've ever written have been formal reports or congratulatory telegrams...
Let me take a look at what you have so far.
Here.
"Nenohi..." That's it!?

Fields.MenuText: What attracts you so much to letter writing?
How do you maintain so many pen pals?
Did you struggle to write when you first started?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a way to ensure the friendships I make will be eternal. No matter where our journeys take us, we'll never be more than a pen and paper away.
It's no accident, Kanchou. I try really hard to reply to each pen pal as soon as I can.
Not this much.
Oh...
But these things take time! We all have our different skill sets!
*ALARM*
Ikou, Kanchou? Let's step away from the mean stationery for a while and clear your head. Then we can return and I can help you.
I'd like that.
@BATTLE
How about we try writing a letter to your family? It doesn't matter who. Just tell them how you are doing and that you miss them.
Ganbaru...
Hai! Kanchou, ganbatte! Ōensuruyo!
*ALARM*
Well, this has been a productive session. What say we take a break and take down these Morganas?
But you haven't written anything yet!
It's not my fault. Duty calls.
Oh, no, no, no. You sit. I'll take care of these Morganas and be back to check on you afterwards.
@BATTLE
Wah~ Tsukareta~ How is the letter coming along, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: It's... something!

Fields.DialogueText: May I take a look?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not that confident about it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure it's fine. Let me take a look.

Fields.MenuText: Do I have to show you?

Fields.DialogueText: No need to be shy. We're all friends here.
"Work is going fine... Sometimes I worry about the war, but with Nenohi by my side... I hope to see you soon."
What's the verdict?
It's wonderful, Kanchou. You're a natural. I foresee no problems with you writing more in the future.
Thank you. It isn't often a person of my rank gets to learn a new skill.
We all have room to grow, Kanchou. Me with my radio, you with your letter. Never forget that friends exist to bring out the best in each other!
Friends, huh? Sore dake ka na...
Eh? What did you just say? It was Japanese, right? I wasn't expecting it, so I couldn't catch it.
Kinishinaide. It was nothing.
But it sounded serious! Kanchou! Tell me!
Where do you think this mystery island could lead?
Still staring at that postcard, huh?
It's intoxicating, Kanchou. Part of the reason I enjoy writing to friends is because I'm so curious as to what's happening in their lives.
I see.
Only now, to be met with a foe like this... My inquisitive mind can't take it!

Fields.MenuText: Have you done much traveling?

Fields.DialogueText: In Japan, yes, quite a lot. I've visited most of the country's coasts from north to south. Very little outside of my homeland, unfortunately.

Fields.MenuText: Where do you hope it is?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd love to go to South America. Apparently, the heat there is as intense as Japan's, if not more - but it's less humid and surprisingly comfortable.

Fields.MenuText: Can't you try to forget about it?

Fields.DialogueText: Have we met before!?
*ALARM*
Morganas! Maybe you can press them for some information!
Hai! Ganbaru!
@BATTLE
No! It can't be Europe! The foliage suggests a hotter country!
Everything all right, Nenohi? I only left the bridge for a moment and I come back to this screaming match.
Shinpaishinaide, Kanchou. We're not angry, just excited! I'm talking with everyone I know and seeing if they have ever visited a place from my postcard.
And how's it going so far?
Muri ka na... Nobody knows anything.
You're not one to give up so easily, are you?
Of course not! In fact, while conducting research, I managed to negotiate a trade deal.
What kind of deal?
We can receive information about the island as well as some new weaponry, in exchange for your blessing on this person's business. Someone of your rank endorsing them should do wonders for sales!

Fields.MenuText: That should be fine. Put in the offer.
I don't feel comfortable using my rank for such matters.

Fields.DialogueText: But, Kanchou! The island! We'll never... No, you're right. Shōganai...
Yatta! I'll reply straight away!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Are you ready for battle?
Mochiron! Ikuzō!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We're in the business of naval defense, not brokerage.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose so, Kanchou. We'll get to the bottom of this another way.
Kanchou~ Mitsuketa~.
Nenohi...
Kanchou... you sucked the spirit right out of me... why are you looking at me so intensely...? Hazukashiiyo...
Is that your finished letter in your hand?
It is...
I finished mine as well...
Sōka... Then we should probably read them...
That we should...

Fields.MenuText: You...!

Fields.DialogueText: I think we should--!
You should definitely--!
Maybe we could--!
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Morganas!
Fight!
Hai!
Good!
Okay!
@BATTLE
Yappari, Kanchou. It's too embarrassing to read my letter aloud.
I have an idea. What if we each read the other's letter aloud?
That would do away with a lot of the embarrassment...

Fields.MenuText: What kind of embarrassing stuff did you write?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't write anything embarrassing! At least not to me...

Fields.MenuText: Where should we go?

Fields.DialogueText: Somewhere quiet. Maybe the engine room, or your quarters!

Fields.MenuText: Any other qualms?

Fields.DialogueText: I think it's a great idea, Kanchou!
You know, reading these letters to each other in such close proximity... It's almost like we're reciting wedding vo--
*ALARM*
Morganas! Ignore me, Kanchou, I'm talking nonsense! To battle!
@BATTLE
Jya, Kanchou... Onegai, saki ni ike...
Very well, here you go...
*Ahem* "Nenohi, so much time has passed since our first meeting. I'm surprised every day by how much you push me to better myself and how much I want to better myself for you..."
Kanchou~~!

Fields.MenuText: Don't just stop halfway through!

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen! Gaman dekinakatta! Tsuzuku.

Fields.MenuText: Don't look at me like that!

Fields.DialogueText: Who knew you were such a romantic!?

Fields.MenuText: Wipe that smile off your face! That's an order!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou! Wiping commenced!
*ALARM*
Mate! Let's deal with these Morganas first. I want to read every word without any distractions.
@BATTLE
Okay, I'll continue your letter, Kanchou.
Please be quick...
"Whether it's scouring the world for for a glimpse at your mystery paradise, or looking out onto the seas from the deck, I'm satisfied as long as you're by my side."

Fields.MenuText: There! Are you happy now?
So? Say something!
How was it?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! More than you can imagine!
I've never seen your face so red!
Wonderful, Kanchou! Hontōni kandōshita!
*ALARM*
Quickly! Let's take care of these Morganas and get back to the real finale! YOUR letter!
I suppose it is about that time. Hai!
@BATTLE
Jya, Kanchou, please read my letter to you.
"Kanchou, this has been the hardest letter I've ever had to write."
"Normally, this kind of thing comes easy to me. But when it comes to you, I'm at a loss for words."
Yada! Don't read it all! Just pick a section.

Fields.MenuText: The middle?
The next few lines?
The end?

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. Proceed.
Fine. Proceed.
Fine. Proceed.
"You always challenge me to reach new heights. I thank you for your generosity not only in opening up your wallet to satisfy me, but in spending your free time with me as well."
"I've never been so speechless before. Although, part of me hopes you already know how I feel."
"I'll be by your side forever, Kanchou. As long as you'll have me."
*ALARM*
Wow...
Kanchou... Morganas...
Wow...
Nande sono kao! Mō, I'll take care of them in your stead!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? You came to meet me up here?
I wanted to return your letter.
Ie. You keep it, Kanchou. If you'll let me keep yours.
Of course.
So, what did you think of my letter?

Fields.MenuText: I was moved.
It was so romantic.
Do you really want to know?

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Ureshii...
There are still a few Morganas around. Please bear with me while I take them out!
@BATTLE
That wasn't my intention, but I'm glad you liked it...
Why!? Is your answer going to plague me so much?!
It was great to read, and learning why you love letters so much was the best part.
If we stay together and search for my mystery island, I'd be happy to share even more personal information about myself. If you'd like, that is...
I'd like that a lot. Here's to more adventures with you by my side!
Hai! Kanchou!
